message.content:
cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.CY, cs.SI, cs.CR 

This paper is likely to belong to the sub-category of cs.LG (Machine Learning) as it focuses on optimizing the learning objective of collaborative filtering recommender systems. It also involves the use of fairness metrics, which is a growing area of research in machine learning. 

It could also belong to cs.IR (Information Retrieval) as recommender systems are commonly used in information retrieval applications. 

Additionally, it could be categorized under cs.CY (Computers and Society) as it addresses the issue of discrimination in historical data and proposes fairness metrics to mitigate it. 

It may also fall under cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) as recommender systems are often used in social networks and the paper discusses the impact of historical biases on minority groups of users. 

Finally, it could be classified under cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) as fairness is an important aspect of security and privacy in machine learning systems.
